docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 28 -- Foreign Minister Adolfo Mugica resigned tonight in the wake of an uproar over his public statements about a recent meeting between Maj. Ernesto Guevara, Cuba's Minister of Industry, and Richard N. Goodwin, President Kennedy's...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 28 -- Foreign Minister Adolfo Mugica resigned tonight in the wake of an uproar over his public statements about a recent meeting between Maj. Ernesto Guevara, Cuba's Minister of Industry, and Richard N. Goodwin, President Kennedy's assistant for Latin American Affairs.

headline.main: TOP FRONDIZI AIDE QUITS UNDER FIRE; Foreign Minister Criticized in Uproar Over Guevara TOP FRONDIZI AIDE QUITS UNDER FIRE

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Aug. 28 -- Premier Fidel Castro denied tonight that the food shortages in Cuba had made his country more eager to negotiate with the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Aug. 28 -- Premier Fidel Castro denied tonight that the food shortages in Cuba had made his country more eager to negotiate with the United States.
docs.abstract: Castro denies shortages make Cuba eager for talks with US, s, conf; reiterates conf theme that increased demand, not output drop, caused shortages; says '60 output was up; pledges steps to assure adequate supplies by '62; derides NY Times dispatch on Guevara becoming scapegoat

headline.main: Food Increase Pledged; CASTRO EXHORTS BRAZIL TO REVOLT

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 -- Administration officials viewed today Premier Fidel Castro's advice to Brazilians to wage guerrilla war against the army as outright intervention in the affairs of Brazil.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 -- Administration officials viewed today Premier Fidel Castro's advice to Brazilians to wage guerrilla war against the army as outright intervention in the affairs of Brazil.
docs.abstract: US officials privately view Castro plea for revolt in Brazil as outright intervention; refrain from pub comment; Deputy Asst Sec de Coerr tells Sen com US maintains 'continuing hands-off policy,'

headline.main: CASTRO ACCUSED OF INTERVENTION; U.S. Views Plea for Revolt in Brazil as Meddling

byline.original: By TAD SZULC Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: TEL AVIV, Aug. 29 (AP) -- The sixth Maccabiah games were declared open today by president Itzhak Ben-Zvi in a moving ceremony that brought tears to many among the 30,000 spectators in Ramat Gan Stadium.
docs.lead_paragraph: TEL AVIV, Aug. 29 (AP) -- The sixth Maccabiah games were declared open today by president Itzhak Ben-Zvi in a moving ceremony that brought tears to many among the 30,000 spectators in Ramat Gan Stadium.

headline.main: 30,000 IN ISRAEL SEE GAMES OPEN; U.S. Athletes Cheered at Maccabiah Ceremonies

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANIERO, Aug. 29 -- Brazil faced a critical situation tonight as an army commander in the south announced his defiance of the high command in the crisis over the Presidential succession.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANIERO, Aug. 29 -- Brazil faced a critical situation tonight as an army commander in the south announced his defiance of the high command in the crisis over the Presidential succession.
docs.abstract: Goulart backed by 3d Army comdr Gen Lopes, by Gov and mil forces of Goias state and in broadcasts by 5 radio stations; mil clash feared; support proclaimed despite announcement by 3 mil mins that Goulart return was 'absolutely inconvenient'; Cong comm seeks Const formula to end crisis; acting Speaker Magalhaes reptdly claims Cong majority backs Goulart; Kubitschek reptdly assures Goulart of support but advises him to stay in Paris until situation clears

headline.main: BRAZIL ARMY UNIT BACKING GOULART; CLASH IS FEARED; Military Chiefs Are Reported to Bar Compromise to Let Leftist Head Nation VICE PRESIDENT DEFIANT Vows to Return to Fulfill 'Constitutional Duties' but Does Not Say When BRAZIL ARMY UNIT BACKING GOULART

byline.original: By EDWARD C. BURKS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Vice President Joao Goulart of Brazil flew here from Paris yesterday and said he was planning to return home "as soon as possible" to assume the Presidency vacated by Dr. Janio Quadros.
docs.lead_paragraph: Vice President Joao Goulart of Brazil flew here from Paris yesterday and said he was planning to return home "as soon as possible" to assume the Presidency vacated by Dr. Janio Quadros.
docs.abstract: Goulart in NYC; plans return to Brazil soon to assume Pres; says Denys knows he is not a Communist; reptdly seeks guarantees he will not be held on arrival in Brazil; leaves for Panama

headline.main: GOULART ASSERTS HE IS PRESIDENT; Flies Here From Paris and Then Leaves for Panama

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 -- President Kennedy adopted today a position of interested neutrality on the Brazilian crisis and criticized by inference the efforts of Premier Fidel Castro to influence developments in Brazil.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 -- President Kennedy adopted today a position of interested neutrality on the Brazilian crisis and criticized by inference the efforts of Premier Fidel Castro to influence developments in Brazil.
docs.abstract: Rio demonstration illus; Kennedy says Brazilians will solve crisis without outside interference, news conf; implied criticism of Castro seen

headline.main: PRESIDENT URGES CARE ON BRAZIL; U.S. Neutral as Issue Is Up to Brazilians, He Says

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 -- A Senate subcommittee said tonight that it was satisfied that an encounter in Montevideo Uruguay, between Maj. Ernesto Guevara of Cuba and a White House aide two weeks ago had been a casual and unimportant meeting at a cocktail...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 -- A Senate subcommittee said tonight that it was satisfied that an encounter in Montevideo Uruguay, between Maj. Ernesto Guevara of Cuba and a White House aide two weeks ago had been a casual and unimportant meeting at a cocktail party.
docs.abstract: Goodwin questioned by Sen subcom on Montevideo encounter with Guevara; Sen Morse repts subcom satisfied talk was casual

headline.main: U.S. AIDE BACKED ON GUEVARA CHAT; Senate Unit Accepts Report Talk Was Informal

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 31 -- Vice President Joao Goulart reached the last stop on his roundabout return trip to Brazil here today. He must now decide when and how to reenter his politically divided country.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 31 -- Vice President Joao Goulart reached the last stop on his roundabout return trip to Brazil here today. He must now decide when and how to reenter his politically divided country.
docs.abstract: disavowal of communism during Lima stopover noted

headline.main: GOULART ARRIVES AT MONTEVIDEO; Must Now Decide on Way to Try to Re-enter Brazil

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times
